official-title.#text: To establish a maximum limitation on the amount of the payment standard that may be used with respect to housing choice vouchers provided under the Moving to Work program of the Department of Housing and Urban Development.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Fairness and Accountability In Rental Assistance Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fairness and Accountability In Rental Assistance Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 204 of the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 1996
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 1996/s:204

header.#text: Limitation on Moving to Work program payment standards
Limitation on rental assistance payment standards

text.#text: In no case may the payment standard used in connection with a voucher for tenant-based rental assistance provided under the demonstration under this section on behalf of any family that is not a family described in paragraph (2) exceed 120 percent of the fair market rental established pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for the applicable market area and size of dwelling unit.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 8(c) of the United States Housing Act of 1937

text.#text: A family described in this paragraph is—
an elderly family (as such term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3(b)(3) of the United States Housing Act of 1937

text.#text: a disabled family (as such term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may provide, except that this subparagraph shall not apply with respect to any area after the first adjustment to the fair market rental for such area occurring after the declaration of such major disaster.

text.#text: a family that resides, at the time of a major disaster declared pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in a principal residence that is located within an area for which such major disaster was declared, and meets such other conditions and requirements as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 401 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:401

text.#text: The amendment made by section 2 shall apply with respect to rental assistance provided under the Moving to Work program pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 204 of the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 1996
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 1996/s:204

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5374 IH: Fairness and Accountability In Rental Assistance Act of 2014
